image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Texas; born in San Antonio, Bexar County, Tex., January 2, 1954; graduated from South San Antonio High School, San Antonio, Tex., 1972; B.J., University of Texas, Austin, Tex., 1976; journalist; broadcasting executive; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2007); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: "Henry Bonilla" in Hispanic Americans in Congress, 1822-2012. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of the Historian and the Office of the Clerk, U.S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing Office, 2013.

researchRecord.name: 1994, 6 commercials on 1 videocassette.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Henry Bonilla's campaign for the 1994 U.S. congressional election in District 23 of Texas, Republican Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication
